meanings.definition: The belief that all events have been predetermined by a higher power.
meanings.sent1: Predestinarianism teaches that everything is already decided by a greater force.
meanings.sent2: Many people follow predestinarianism and trust in fate.
meanings.sent3: The debate on predestinarianism can get quite intense among scholars.
meanings.sent4: In the world of predestinarianism, every outcome is like a scripted play.
meanings.sent5: The concept of predestinarianism can be both comforting and unsettling.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that God has already chosen who will be saved and who will be damned.
meanings.sent1: Predestinarianism believes that God has already decided our eternal fate.
meanings.sent2: Some find solace in predestinarianism, knowing their destiny is secure.
meanings.sent3: The idea of predestinarianism can lead to deep theological discussions.
meanings.sent4: For those who embrace predestinarianism, salvation is a predetermined path.
meanings.sent5: The principle of predestinarianism shapes how some view life's purpose.
